alert.note: Alert for Northern Hancock; Pearl River; Southern Hancock (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 8:06PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central St. Tammany and south central Washington Parishes, western Hancock and southwestern Pearl River Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 804 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sun to 7 miles northwest of Kiln. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Winds could precede thunderstorms by as much as 10 minutes. Locations impacted include... Picayune, Pearl River, Abita Springs, Sun, Stennis Space Center and Bush. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana near mile marker 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 4. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 3 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern Hancock; Pearl River; Southern Hancock
